sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An old song of the old courtier of the kings, with a new song of a new courtier of the kings. The tune is, The Queens old courtier. Howard, Thomas, 17th/18th cent.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for F. Coles, in Wine-street, on Saffron-Hill, near Hatton-Garden, London : [1670?]
Signed at end: Written by T. Howard, Gent. Verse: "An old song made, of an old". Date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996. In two parts, printed side by side. Copy cut and mounted. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
An old song of the old courtier of the kings, with a new song of a new courtier of the kings. The tune is, The Queens old courtier. Howard, Thomas, 17th/18th cent.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for F. Coles, in Wine-street, on Saffron-Hill, near Hatton-Garden, London : [1670?]
Signed at end: Written by T. Howard, Gent. Verse: "An old song made, of an old". Date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996. In two parts, printed side by side. Copy cut and mounted. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
F. Coles
Wine-street, on Saffron-Hill, near Hatton-Garden
